ETYMOLOGY: From Old French leçon (from Latin lectiō, nominative lectiōn- 'a reading, a lesson'), from legere 'to read'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun). Here, it is a countable noun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A period of learning or teaching, especially in a school or by a private tutor.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一段学习或教学的时间，尤指在学校或由私人教师进行的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I have a piano lesson every Tuesday afternoon.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我每周二下午都有一节钢琴课。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun). Here, it is a countable noun, often used idiomatically.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An experience or event that teaches you something important, often about how to behave or what not to do.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一次经历或事件，教会你一些重要的东西，通常是关于如何行为或不该做什么。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He learned a valuable lesson about honesty from that incident.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他从那件事中吸取了关于诚实的重要一课。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun). Here, it is a countable noun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A passage from the Bible or another text read aloud as part of a religious service, or a section of a textbook or course of study.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在宗教仪式中大声朗读的圣经或其他文本的段落；教科书或课程中的一部分。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The first lesson was taken from the Book of Isaiah.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 第一段经文选自《以赛亚书》。
